page.title: 08River-keeper 1:The Deverills
page.content: {The River-keeper}looks after a two and a half mile stretch of{the River Wylye from{Hill Deverill}to{Crockerton.}His main job is cutting weeds to prevent them blocking the river. The waterweed grows very rapidly in the summer months and the River-keeper makes three cuts, wading the river and cutting the weed with a large scythe. The most common weed is water crowfoot(ranunculus aquatilis) which in flower looks like a white buttercup. The River-keeper also keeps the river banks clear cutting back long grass for fishermen.He mends the footbridges and trims the over-hanging trees.He looks after every aspect of the life of the river, and in the summer tries to deter children from swimming in the river, as it is unsafe.
